Sentencas: Reduction process plays an important role before solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) start to work.
Titulo: Effects of reduction process on the electrochemical and microstructural properties for electrolyte-supported SOFC

Sentencas: The reduced anode must have enough porosity for transferring the fuel gases and good conductivity for decreasing the area specific resistance.
Titulo: Effects of reduction process on the electrochemical and microstructural properties for electrolyte-supported SOFC

Sentencas: To investigate how the reduction process affects the electrochemical and microstructural properties for electrolyte-supported SOFC with a nickel oxide/yttria-stabilized zirconia (NiO/YSZ) anode, three different reduction processes are applied to the same batch of cells in this paper.
Titulo: Effects of reduction process on the electrochemical and microstructural properties for electrolyte-supported SOFC

Sentencas: Process I for one of tested cells is to introduce a dilute gas of 20% hydrogen and 80% nitrogen to the anode side at room temperature.
Titulo: Effects of reduction process on the electrochemical and microstructural properties for electrolyte-supported SOFC

Sentencas: Process II and III for the others are to introduce the same dilute gas while the cells are heated up to 800 and 700 degrees C respectively.
Titulo: Effects of reduction process on the electrochemical and microstructural properties for electrolyte-supported SOFC

Sentencas: Although the Process I provides much time to reduce the anode of the cell, the resulting performance is lower than the others.
Titulo: Effects of reduction process on the electrochemical and microstructural properties for electrolyte-supported SOFC

Sentencas: AC impedance analyses show that the cell reduced at higher temperature has lower ohmic and polarization resistance.
Titulo: Effects of reduction process on the electrochemical and microstructural properties for electrolyte-supported SOFC

Sentencas: Moreover, the differences of nickel connection and particle size on the anode are observed in microstructure of the cells, which proves that reduction process has a vital effect for solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Effects of reduction process on the electrochemical and microstructural properties for electrolyte-supported SOFC
